definition: inspiration in a moment of desperation (idiom)/also written 情急之下

sentences.english: He was also very impatient, he couldn't wait for anything.
sentences.chinese: 他性情急躁，對任何事情都沒有耐心。

sentences.english: She could be relied on in a crisis.
sentences.chinese: 情急之下，她是可以依靠的。

sentences.english: He made a small ratchet of panic and that was it.
sentences.chinese: 他只是做了個情急慌亂之下的本能掙扎就放棄了。

sentences.english: In desperation, he decided to throw the helve after the hatchet, in tribute tea against Hu poisoned.
sentences.chinese: 情急之下，他決定孤注一擲，在貢茶裏下毒陷害胡家。

sentences.english: Aishan has no choice but to reveal that Youli is in love with Ah Bing and not her.
sentences.chinese: 愛善情急之下爆出有禮愛的是阿冰，衆人愕然。

sentences.english: Desperate, she and SONG Huai get hold bladed knife.
sentences.chinese: 情急之下，她握住刀刃和宋懷搶刀。

sentences.english: You should forgive him for saying that, he was too eager.
sentences.chinese: 他情急之下說錯了話，你應該諒解他。

sentences.english: The woman driver naturally shouted for help.
sentences.chinese: 女司機情急呼救，全車乘客噤若寒蟬。

definition: quick witted in an emergency/able to react resourcefully
in a great rush/in a flurry
to speak incoherently/to ramble/to talk irresponsibly
see 驚慌失措|惊慌失措[jing1 huang1 shi1 cuo4]
variant of 倉促|仓促[cang1 cu4]
inspiration in a moment of desperation (idiom)/also written 情急之下
slip of the tongue/indiscretion/to blurt out a secret
